projects.description: A simple web application that displays randomly selected quotes from a database according to a set timer interval. Takes a JSON file with information relating to a series of popular Star Trek quotes, and dynamically injects this into the DOM. A randomised background colour generator adds to the user experience.

projects.description: Demonstration of data pagination techniques using array and index filtering methods. Information is taken from an array and dynamically inserted into custom user cards. Pagination at the bottom of the page allows users to move between populated pages. A live search function filters available user information, and affects the pagination display.

An interactive event booking form with input validation. Incorrect user input is responded to with custom feedback to help correct the information provided. Drop down selection options vary depending on user selection. Payment information is live validated, and correct data input is highlighted in green, while incorrect input receives a similar customised note.

thumbs.alt: Form validation with customised feedback to refine user input
Form input validation showing correct and incorrect data entry

projects.description: A word guessing game developed using vanilla javascript and custom user phrases. The user is able to start the game from a landing page, and then select letters from an on-screen keyboard. Incorrect answers result in the user losing a life, while correct answers present the letter on the display. Running out of lives means that the user has lost the game, and receives an appropriate message allowing them to start again. Correctly guessing the phrase allows the user to play again.

projects.description: A web application that fetches profiles from the random user api to populate a paginated employee directory site. User information is randomly generated, and will populate with different content every refresh. Employees can be sorted using a live search filter, and more information can be accessed via a dynamic modal popup.

projects.description: The final capstone submission for Team Treehouse's Front End Web Development Techdegree. This is a work in progress that required further updating, but demonstrates a range of front end web development skills. Highlights of the project involved the manual creation of animated gradient texts, animated content elements, and the implementation of intersection observers to improve user feedback and interactivity.
